title: Getting support docs
introduction: Use the docs and API and SDK reference to learn about support plan options, how to use the Support Center for self-guided resolutions to your issues, and how to open and manage support cases when needed.

section_recommended.title: Using the Support Center
section_recommended.description: Discover the best way to get the support that you need by utilizing the Support Center.

section_recommended.title: Basic, Advanced, and Premium support plans
section_recommended.description: IBM Cloud offers different support plans to fit your business needs.

section_recommended.title: Creating support cases
section_recommended.description: Create a support case to have a support engineer review your issue and help you resolve the problem you're experiencing.

tiles.title: View email notification history
tiles.description: You can use the Communication history page in the console to check the status of all email notifications that are sent you to verify if the emails are being delivered successfully. You can also view the last 90 days of IBM Cloud email history, which can help save you time troubleshooting any delivery issues without needing to contact IBM support.

tiles.title: Getting help in the console
tiles.description: You can now find the documentation and Support Center help options from a single menu item in the IBM Cloud console menu bar. Check out the new Help option from the menu bar that now includes your links for Docs, the Support Center, a form to give us feedback, and available guided tours.

tiles.title: 365 days of status history is now available
tiles.description: You can now easily view events that were completed in the past year on the IBM Cloud Status page. Previously, you could view only the history of completed events from the past month.
